intro: Danaea oligosora, commonly known as the dwarf flame flower, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Melastomataceae and is characterized by its striking, tubular red flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows as a low shrub, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters, with glossy, dark green leaves. Its flowers are pollinated primarily by hummingbirds, which are attracted to its nectar-rich blooms. Danaea oligosora is often cultivated for its ornamental value in shaded garden settings.
